title: Lagoon cockle

content.title: External appearance
content.content: A marine bivalve with a white to greyish-white shell. The outside of the shell is ribbed and has a serrated edge. The shell can grow up to 50 mm, but in Latvia they only grow to 20 mm because the Baltic Sea is not saline enough.

content.title: Distribution
content.content: The lagoon cockle inhabits the Baltic, Black, Caspian and Mediterranean Seas. The shells are often seen washed up on the Baltic coast, especially along the Gulf of Riga.

content.title: Ecology
content.content: Inhabits shallow waters. Young bivalves live on aquatic plants; as they mature, they move to the sandy bottom.

fact: Due to its high variability, the species has developed a large number of synonyms. In many places people use cockles as a source of food.
